title.narrative: 3.1 EDUCATION SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: 3.1 By 2025, the Government has the required capacity to operationalize an integrated social protection system in line with international standards (child-sensitive and shock responsive social protection frameworks), which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Digital Transformation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more children, especially the most vulnerable benefit from inclusive and equitable early childhood education (ECE), quality basic education and improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1 By 2025, the Government has the required capacity to operationalize an integrated social protection system in line withinternational standards (child-sensitive and shock responsive social protection frameworks)

description.narrative: Government of Uzbekistan is now better edquipped to conceptualize, plan, and implement evidence-based, gender-sensitive and inclusive education programmes in education. UNICEF&39;s continous and comprehensive evidence-based technical support and guidance are bringing tangible results, such as the introduction of inclusive education programme in 42 schools; 90 percent of schools getting enhanced internet access throughout the country and more than 2500 parents having access to required resources to stimulate early childhood development. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
